This has been suggested before.... Nothing obviously evr came of it...

I would like to see this as well

I seriously can't imagine how can you make complex vessels on a smartphone or tablet. Simple Planes is already pretty tricky and there are only a few parts compared to what KSP has.

But a Telemachus-like readouts is something I'd like to see on my phone.
Even if not for phone or tablet, it would be nice to see a web-based, or even stand-alone program/app to do this...

I'm not convinced it's that practical for anything but the larger tablets at best, I don't think processing power would be a major issue, it would just be too fiddly graphically to be useable.  It might work for a trimmed down version of the editors, sort of a 'back of an envelope ' design concept builder.  It could have all the main parts, but leave out the small fiddly stuff (like fuel lines, struts and small radial attached bits) to be added later in the editor proper.  This would allow you to try out basic ideas and get them down on the fly when the boss isn't looking on the bus home.
hey that's a good idea for planning your ships. i reckon ksp should have it too cause it really helps me drop down my ship ideas on a tablet quickly instead of drawing em out.
Craft files are just json, wouldnt be hard to write your own app in something like xamarin.
